benchmark_details.name: LLMs as verification oracles for Solidity
benchmark_details.overview: This paper provides the first systematic evaluation of GPT-5 in the role of verification oracles for Solidity smart contracts by benchmarking its performance on a large dataset of verification tasks, comparing its outputs against established formal verification tools, and assessing its effectiveness in real-world auditing scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the viability of using LLMs for smart contract verification.

data.source: Constructed dataset containing 2034 verification tasks from different Solidity use cases.
data.annotation: Manually crafted properties and mutations for verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on predictions versus ground truth from verification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate strong reasoning capabilities of the LLM, especially in GPT-5 over GPT-4.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-5 achieved over 85% accuracy across all prediction metrics and outperformed GPT-4 by a margin of 25%-30%.
methodology.validation: Tested against established verification tools SolCMC and Certora.
